abstract: Despite the enthusiasm of analysts and investors, the rumored acquisition of Bristol-Myers Squibb by Paris-based Sanofi-Aventis is probably a bad idea in the long term, writes Forbes’ Matthew Herper. Such a deal would be a short-term fix that does nothing to address the drug industry’s big problems: a declining pipeline and fewer medicines reaching patients.
